data.title: Snipers hidden depending on their environment
data.body: Snipers could be always visible if they are in the middle of nowhere, like in the center of a desert plain, and become cloaked if they are near some trees (for example). So the environment would have an impact on the gameplay (and on map creation) instead of being simply walkable/non-walkable areas.

data.title: Predefined chat messages ?
data.body:
Like
F1 = "Enemy nuke missile soon"
F2 = "Enemy nuke truck coming"
F3 = "Tanya in base"
...
Or any others keys combinations / chat messages.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5478260-predefined-chat-messages?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Update ai.yaml
data.body: Added new AI Like Red alert on ps1 retaliation,with dogs,tesla tanks ,mammoth....

data.title: Balancing: Increased BIKE cost to 600
data.body:
Hoping to squeeze this into this release.

Recon bikes are not overpowered, but given what they bring to the battlefield - dealing very similar damage to bazooka infantry and being the fastest unit in the game - for only $500 a unit at tier 1, some players only strategy now is spamming huge recon bike armies, which devolves the game into a boring starcraft-zerg-rush style mess. Newbies get mopped the floor with these bikes and it certainly doesn't help with the latency.

$600 is fair; it doesn't nerf the bikes and puts them on par with the cost of other units. Players can still spam them if that's what they want to spend their cash on, but are no longer rewarded for doing so.

data.title: Make the legacy editor more robust against invalid templates.
data.body: Fixes #6812.

data.title: Rewrite shp(ts) parsing to avoid offset issues.
data.body: Fixes #6822.  May also fix #6020, but I don't have a testcase for that.

data.title: Offset issues with SHP(TS)
data.body:
The offset of SHP(ts) files are still not 'stable'.
Remove/comment out the ShadowIndex of the chrome palette in TS, and then click on something buildable in-game and watch the clock animation closely for a good test case.

Possibly a duplicate of #6020, but that one has a misleading title.

data.title: D2k: Sandworms implementation
data.body: Using Mailaender's code as basis, this is my implementation of the sandworm behavior. It is still WIP, but you can get an idea of how it looks from the shellmap.

data.title: Add support for rectangular hitboxes
data.body: The health radius is suboptimal for visually rectangular and/or long units (tanks, ships, some buildings). While it might complicate the damage calculations compared to a simple radius, it would allow for hitboxes matching the visual shape, and might even be a first step towards directional armor.

data.title: Map Editor lacks "actors"
data.body:
The last version I played had plenty of different actors such as groups of trees that I could place into a map. The newer version lacks these small 'forrest' type actors.

data.title: Support mission-specific music
data.body:
From ra's rules.ini:

```
; ******* Theme Controls *******
; Controls when each theme becomes available in solo play. Each
; theme identifier is given a scenario and owner. The theme will
; become available at that scenario or later and for the specified
; owner only. If no owner is specified, it is presumed to be available
; for all sides.
[ThemeControl]
BIGF226M=1,Soviet
CRUS226M=1,Allies
FAC1226M=1,Soviet
HELL226M=1
FAC2226M=2,Soviet
RUN1226M=2,Soviet
TREN226M=3,Soviet
WORK226M=3,Allies
AWAIT=4
DENSE_R=5,Soviet
FOGGER1A=5,Allies
MUD1A=6
RADIO2=7,Soviet
ROLLOUT=7,Allies
SNAKE=8
TERMINAT=9,Soviet
TWIN=9,Allies
VECTOR1A=10
SMSH226M=11
```

This will prevent the version from being set to null if git isn't in the
path.

Adds ability to also provide version string manually.

Fixes #6815

data.title: Make.cmd version sets version string to null if git doesn't exist.
data.body: make.cmd version will set the version value to blank if git is not found.

update hard coded references to chrome.yaml to use public parameters.

Fixes #6808

data.title: Missing .lua files/outdated LuaScripts: reference in mod.yamls
data.body:
Either the lua files got deleted by accident (unlikely), or someone forgot to delete the `LuaScripts:` reference from the mod.yaml files (more likely).

Edit: It's the latter of course ;)

data.title: Do not pick new map randomly when you have edited the map?
data.body:
Could it be possible it remembered the map by name, and wouldnt pick up a random map every time the map was edited?

It's a bit tedious to select the same map every time you change something in the map.yaml.

Don't say the new map editor will fix this, because even if it supported editing the raw map.yaml file for map rules etc, i wouldnt use it since such ingame editors fail at text editing at 99.99% chance. Notepad++ ftw!

data.title: Audio slider does not appear in current playtest
data.body:
There is no visible slider for the audio adjustment, though it still works adjusting the audio.

![slider](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1894790/4713915/37ff6ed2-58e9-11e4-859a-83d8918270d4.png)

data.title: Lua cleanups
data.body:
- Made gdi04c easier. And there was much rejoicing.
- Lua API documentation fixes
- Moves a small number of functions to more appropriate places. I'd like to get this done before the release is out so that we wouldn't have to change a released API.

Depending on what's get merged first, either this PR or #6748, #6792, #6795 and #6796 will need to be adjusted accordingly.

data.title: RenderInfantry trait name is misleading
data.body: ...as it no longer contains infantry-specific stuff like death animations and screams, and can be used for mechs and similar animated units.

data.title: Investigate signing our windows installers
data.body:
This would hopefully help with the windows smartscreen and virus scanner false positives.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Signing_an_executable_with_Authenticode
http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/encrypting-files/ can be used to encrypt the private key.
http://nsis.sourceforge.net/Signing_an_Uninstaller

data.title: Is the Actor name used anywhere in map.yaml?
data.body:
In map.yaml "Actor11":

``` Actors:
    Actor11: v05
        Location: 40,32
        Owner: Neutral
```

Can that "Actor11" be referenced to anywhere in the map? And how?

data.title: Fix a crash when double-clicking a replay with an unknown map.
data.body: Reproducible with any replay created before #6783 was merged.

#6601 minus the patch changing AnnounceOnBuild (which was due to a misunderstanding).

This has already been reviewed in the linked pr.
